recommendations.recommendation: A new genre is born: "baking shounen" - hard work and guts also help in a bakery!

Absolutely love it, no matter how many time I re-watch it!!! Always makes me wanna eat varieties of bread too *drool*. A must to watch, interesting & hilarious too <3 Ohh ~ I learned a few tips on baking bread from this anime & manga lol ~~

This show will teach you alot. Most importantly how awesomely crucial "reactions" are to evaluate breads in a competition. Also, what awesome things a "woooorld level clown" can do. (Which is pretty much anything you could ever imagine.)
This show is a side-buster, and it made me bake a ton of bread too. Watch it, laugh till you can`t breathe and then bake some bread!

A novel pan with a magical recipe containing two main ingredients: First, the "reactions", which are mostly plays of vocabs and kanji characters to bring them to life. The "nori" reaction which leads to added "desu" to the series title is the best IMO.
Second, a poisonous and cliche statements throughout the series such as "occhan aa oniisan" and "nan yatte?"
As a side dish, it offers fruitless love for the female protagonist, a swinging hair style changes for the "nan yatte?" guy, and a female cockroach-ish hair style for the male protagonist. The samurai chef is cool though!
And don`t miss the dessert. "Boku wa kiddo!"
So, this pan is originally pleasant, but its deep bitterness might catch you and keep you off the corner. Eventually, I dropped it at Ep.54, until after several months, I found myself ready to continue tasting it.
Overall, love it, but maybe too long for the second round.
Really It`s the best show ever.
An odd topic to write on, but the show proves that, somehow, baking bread can be entertaining. Not only that, but it`s actually good!

It`s the good and fun anime Read the manga too, it`s different.
If you want a cooking anime, search for mister ajikko It`s teaching a lot about cooking ouch, that`s Anime is RARE

anime.description: Yakitate means "fresh baked", but the word "Japan" is actually a pun - pan means bread in Japanese, so http://anidb.net/ch1591 [Kazuma] is out to make Japan, a unique Japanese bread to compete with the best bread from around the world! Azuma become obsessed with bread when he was six years old. http://anidb.net/ch1635 [His sister] yelled that their family should start having bread for breakfast sometimes, but http://anidb.net/ch29466 [their grandfather] refused to even consider it, as he would only eat natto, miso soup, and rice for breakfast. Kazuma agreed, saying he didn`t like bread, but his sister kidnaps him and takes him to a bread store to show him the wonders of fresh-baked bread. Not only is Kazuma converted, but the owner discovers that Kazuma has the magical "Hands of the Sun" whose warmth makes them particularly suited to making bread. The owner packs up shop and goes to Tokyo to fulfill his dream of making Japan, but Kazuma continues his bread-baking dream as well, and ends up going to Tokyo himself when he`s sixteen, to compete for a spot at the foremost bread store in Japan - Pantasia!

tag.name: maintenance tags
tag.description: These tags are used for maintenance.

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: tsukkomi
tag.description: A tsukkomi is a comedy duo stock character in a traditional Japanese slapstick stand-up comedy style known as manzai. Tsukkomi characters are the smart, reasonable, and down-to-earth half of the unit; their simple-minded counterparts are the http://anidb.net/t1399 [boke] characters. As a result of their boke counterparts` simple mistakes and gross exaggerations, tsukkomi berate and abuse them both verbally and physically; a very common example of tsukkomi physical abuse is a paper fan slap, which is generally accompanied by a sound effect. Their approximate equivalent in Western culture is the comedy role of straight man.

tag.name: cooking
tag.description: Cooking is the process of preparing food by using heat.

tag.name: prodigy
tag.description: Character is very good at everything he/she does.

tag.name: dynamic
tag.description: Some of the central structural elements in anime are: Plot Continuity How does the plot or several plots unfold. Are they a strictly linear retelling of one big continuing story, a serial, possibly with several side stories, or is the content chopped into a set of unconnected episodes, only sharing the same setting and characters? Stereotype Characters Then there is the question of the character set presentation. Is it completely original, or is it your usual stereotypical character cast. Both choices have their merit, for example it would not really make much sense to reinvent the wheel for a harem anime. Fans of that genre come to expect their favourite stereotype protagonists. Plot Twists Finally there is the question of how complex the plot / the story unfolds. Are there side-plots that merge into the main plot leading to unexpected plot twists, or is the anime quite predictable? The latter would not be appropriate for detective stories. In harem anime on the other hand a foreseeable outcome is actually something the fans will come to expect.

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: setting
tag.description: The setting describes in what time and place an anime takes place. To a certain extent it describes what you can expect from the world in the anime.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: time
tag.description: This placeholder lists different epochs in human history and more vague but important timelines such as the future, the present and the past.

tag.name: place
tag.description: The places the anime can take place in. Includes more specific places such as a country on Earth, as well as more general places such as a dystopia or a mirror world.

tag.name: present
tag.description: Somewhere between past and future.

tag.name: Earth
tag.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun, and the densest and fifth-largest of the eight planets in the Solar System. It is in effect a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). It is circa 4.5 billion years old, and, unless we humans succeed in destroying it over the next couple of centuries, it is expected to last for quite another while, though the changes in the Sun`s emissions due to its aging will likely cause the extinction of everything; the species of earthlings are guaranteed to die, even if we fail to kill them -- unless, of course, we find ourselves another planet and figure out a way to take everything there. Our little planet on a corner of this galaxy may mean nothing in the grand scheme of things, but to its inhabitants it is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it dearly, to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. Being the home to the human civilizations, the Earth is the main setting of most fiction, be it anime or otherwise, but not only are many titles set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by aggressive alien invaders.

tag.name: slapstick
tag.description: Slapstick humour is generally recognized by lots of physical abuse, horseplay and practical jokes. Also often seen are impossible situations, using sounds to illustrate impossible stunts that aren`t shown on-screen and to create tension for audience anticipation.

tag.name: medium awareness
tag.description: Medium awareness is the situational and generally temporary awareness characters in works of fiction have and display of the very fact that they are characters in works of fiction. For example, they may comment about the background music, quip about the script or narration, complain about the roles given to them by the writer or their lack of screen time, see the subtitles that appear on screen, inform the audience about the arrival of the commercial break, and even use medium effects as tools. The most common form of medium awareness is known as breaking the fourth wall, in which characters speak directly to the audience, either to it as a whole or to specific members of it. The "fourth wall" is the imaginary "wall" at the front of the stage of a proscenium theatre through which the audience sees the play; it is a metaphor for the boundary between what happens inside the work, to the characters, and outside it, to the audience.

tag.name: parody
tag.description: Anime that imitate other stories (can be from TV, film, books, historical events, ...) for comic effect by exaggerating the style and changing the content of the original. Also known as spoofs. It can also refer to when whole elements of one work are lifted out of their context and reused.

tag.name: Japan
tag.description: Japan is a sovereign island nation in East Asia. Located in the Pacific Ocean, it lies off the eastern coast of the Asian mainland and stretches from the Sea of Okhotsk in the north to the East China Sea and China in the southwest. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: plot continuity
tag.description: Consistency of the characteristics of persons, plot, objects, places and events seen by the viewer. A single linear focused plot is highly continuous. A truly random plot is highly discontinuous.

tag.name: stereotypes
tag.description: This show presents stereotypes, which are generalizations about a group of people. Examples would be saying that people from a certain country or with a certain hair color are stupid. If the show deals with comedy, the stereotypes are likely to be played on for laughs; if the show is a parody, the stereotypes will be exaggerated to have their flaws exposed and may be used as a form of social commentary.

tag.name: baking
tag.description: The art of making bread, cakes, pastries, pies, tarts, quiches, cookies and similar food in the oven. Mmmm.... smells nice.

tag.name: manga
tag.description: Manga is the lifeblood that drives the anime industry. Everything and its mother is based on manga. However! There are exceptions where the manga was not the basis for the anime. It`s common practice to make manga adaptations of many popular anime, there`s a manga based on Evangelion, and two (one shounen and one shoujo) based on each of Escaflowne and Mahou Tsukai Tai. Also it`s quite common to release manga and anime versions of a story in parallel, for instance Nadesico and Shoujo Kakumei Utena. There are also cases where an anime continues in a manga, as in the case of Angel Beats! and Angel Beats: Heaven`s Door, or reverse. See also http://anidb.net/t6493 [manhua] and http://anidb.net/t5010 [manhwa].

tag.name: France
tag.description: France, officially the French Republic, is a country whose territory consists of metropolitan France in western Europe, as well as several overseas regions and territories. The metropolitan area of France extends from the Mediterranean Sea to the English Channel and the North Sea, and from the Rhine to the Atlantic Ocean. The overseas territories include French Guiana in South America and several islands in the Atlantic, Pacific and Indian oceans. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Europe
tag.description: Europe is a continent located entirely in the Northern Hemisphere and mostly in the Eastern Hemisphere. It is bordered by the Arctic Ocean to the north, the Atlantic Ocean to the west, and the Mediterranean Sea to the south. It comprises the westernmost part of Eurasia. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Americas
tag.description: The Americas, also collectively called America, encompass the totality of the continents of North America and South America. Together they make up most of Earth`s western hemisphere and comprise the New World. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: Asia
tag.description: Asia is Earth`s largest and most populous continent, located primarily in the eastern and northern hemispheres and sharing the continental landmass of Eurasia with the continent of Europe. Asia covers an area of 44,579,000 square kilometers, about 30% of Earth`s total land area and 8.7% of the Earth`s total surface area. The continent, which has long been home to the majority of the human population, was the site of many of the first civilizations. Asia is notable for not only its overall large size and population, but also dense and large settlements as well as vast barely populated regions within the continent of 4.4 billion people. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: action
tag.description: Action anime usually involve a fairly straightforward story of good guys versus bad guys, where most disputes are resolved by using physical force. It often contains a lot of shooting, explosions and fighting.

tag.name: comedy
tag.description: Anime whose central struggle causes hilarious results. These stories are built upon funny characters, situations and events. A comedy anime is laced with humour and sets out to provoke laughter from the audience. Japanese humour can be a bit strange to westerners, so if you`re new to this type of humour, just bear with it; it`ll most likely grow on you if you`re a fan of other kinds of comedy.

tag.name: daily life
tag.description: The antics of the protagonists do not take place in some exotic setting or time, but in everyday life. When not "at the job" this means getting up in the morning, making meals, house cleaning, going shopping or out to eat, visiting the bath house or spa, leisure activities in the spare time, etc. The time "on the job" for students is School Life, for others working in their profession. Daily Life is basically a synonym for everything normal, repetitive, and trivial happening to your average person.

tag.name: unsorted
tag.description: a bunch of tags that still need to be either deleted or moved into proper places.

tag.name: important haircut
tag.description: When a character cuts off his or her hair, it often symbolizes a rite of passage or bout of character growth. A princess striking out on an adventure, or a new recruit at boot camp, for instance. Hair is something that takes time and effort to grow, so parting with it voluntarily can be a powerful act. This is particularly a big deal when women get haircuts. Yet in fiction, even an accidental hair slicing can leave a character with a surprisingly even cut. In many religions (Western Christianity, Ancient Egyptian religion, and others) priests and/or monks cut/shave their hair. Roman Catholic nuns also tend to cut and mantain their hair short under their veils when they enter the nunneries. The cutting of one`s own hair is also a part of Buddhist mythology, specifically something done by Siddhartha himself early on in his path to enlightenment, so anime examples might draw from this as an allusion. There are also some cultures, including Native American and many Asians, where a person would cut his or her hair as an act of grief, disgrace, or even rebellion. In the Confucian tradition, hair (like the rest of your body) is considered a gift from your parents and may not be damaged without a very good reason. Furthermore, prisoners and psychiatric patients commonly have their heads shaved, often to prevent the spread of lice, but sometimes also as a demeaning measure. Source: TVTRope

tag.name: occupation and career
tag.description: The kind of anime which shows the career of a character, usually from the beginning.

tag.name: working life
tag.description: The life of someone actually working on a often less than glamorous job is depicted in this anime. The job is taxing and the pay is low, not really the dream job one would choose to work in. Examples: Working as salesperson in a department store, or as a waitress in a family restaurant.

tag.name: competition
tag.description: Some sort of confrontation occurs in this show. The protagonists "duke it out" via various competitions.

tag.name: motivational anime
tag.description: The anime motivates doing something which is shown in the show (for example club activity, sports, choosing a job, a hobby etc).

tag.name: tournament
tag.description: A competition involving a large number of participants. Such competitions may range from friendly, moderated sporting events to anything-goes, all-out fights to the death. All participants take part in the tournament in want or need of the final goal and possible prizes; which depending on genre, may range from a boastful record at school to great riches and/or the granting of a wish. Depending on the type of tournament, contestants will either act alone, be permitted a team, or construct a team of chance throughout the ongoing competition.

tag.name: following one`s dream
tag.description: No matter what the hardships may be, at least one of the protagonists in this anime is following her/his dream. Examples: To become a professional athlete, a musician, a painter or the ruler of this world!

tag.name: endless battles
tag.description:
Battles or tournament matches that last much longer than needed (compared to other genres) - perhaps even spanning several episodes.
Filler scenes are inserted between the action scenes, painfully lengthening the screen time even further. A long roster of characters (main, secondary, even extras) watches the events, expressing their opinions about the development of the match, trying to predict the outcome, explaining the rules to those who do not know them, and showing their amazement by an oh so surprising turn of events.

tag.name: monster of the week
tag.description: On a pretty much regular basis — weekly or episodic — the protagonists engage in some kind of conflict. This can be an actual showdown between mecha, or the all-out fight against an enemy, or a (car) race that needs to be won. This can make the anime quite repetitive.

tag.name: incomplete story
tag.description: The show does not cover all of the original work (if present) or was cancelled prematurely, leaving plot lines unresolved or aborting character development. Sometimes the show runs through all its initially slotted episodes and adapts all of the original work (if applicable) but fails to present a proper ending, leaving viewers wondering whether they`re missing the final episodes. In some cases, this may overlap with the studio forging an anime-original ending. Such an ending normally manages to allow the show to "finish", but may still suffer from incomplete story issues. An incomplete storyline is not to be confused with the sequel bait, which is when the story presented by the show is finished but leaves enough room for a sequel to be produced. Sometimes this goes as far as to present a new potential problem in the last few minutes; that is usual for after-credits footage in movies.

tag.name: mundane made awesome
tag.description: Sometimes normal just doesn`t cut it. Eating: you put food in your mouth and chew. Playing sports: you throw a ball around. You need to make it awesome, no matter how mundane it is. Let`s throw in some gripping orchestral music, lighting changes, different camera angles, something! Don`t write like a man, write like an evil overlord! Exaggerate your expressions and gestures, speak with excessive intonation, and if all else fails, throw in some close-ups, slow motion, and ominous Latin chanting! With practice, even you can turn something like eating chips into an epic battle of light and dark, blinding the viewer with sheer awesomeness. [Source: TV Tropes]

tag.name: TO BE MOVED TO CHARACTER
tag.description: Tags under this parent tag are going to be moved to character tags and removed from the anime they`re currently assigned to. They will be blocked from the anime system once that move is complete. Please help with that job if you know what characters they should be assigned to.

tag.name: tropes
tag.description: A trope is a commonly recurring literary and rhetorical devices, motifs or clichés in creative works. This use is a broader redefining of a literary trope, the use of figurative language, via word, phrase, or even an image, for artistic effect, such as using a figure of speech. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: ending tags that need merging
tag.description: See also: http://anidb.net/post426253 [http://anidb.net/post426253] and http://anidb.net/c6774745 [http://anidb.net/c6774745]

character.name: Azuma Kazuma
character.description: The 16-year-old male protagonist, a bread artisan who dreams of making the perfect Japan. Initially, he doesn`t seem very bright, but when it comes to bread, he`s a genius. (He is knowledgeable about rice because he lived on a rice farm, and Japanese food in general, due to further learning and dealing with Japanese restaurants.) Azuma also has "Solar Hands": exceptionally warm hands that allow the yeast to ferment faster and better when he is making his bread. Eternally optimistic and cheerful, he never gets upset from challenges faced in baking competitions, but rather from emotional tragedies that occur to characters around him. He gets his inspirations for his Japan from seemingly random sources, like other Japanese foods and stories from his experienced but over-talkative grandfather, who is a rice farmer.

character.name: Azusagawa Tsukino
character.description: Granddaughter to the owner of the Pantasia chain, and understudy to Ken Matsushiro. She seems to have a crush on Azuma, though it is never explicitly stated. Has difficulty getting along with the rest of the Pantasia-involved Azusagawa family because she is an illegitimate child. She is still very dedicated to the Pantasia chain, seeking out talented new bakers (like Azuma and Kawachi) and has garnered the support of many other characters. While she stays behind the scene most of the time, she is implied to be talented, as she managed to make it to the third place of a past newcomer`s battle.

character.name: Matsushiro Ken
character.description: Manager of Pantasia Southern Tokyo branch. A burly man with an afro and sunglasses. Renowned as the best French-bread artisan in Japan, he seems to have a predilection with horses and betting on horse-racing. He is Kuroyanagi`s former teacher, but early on recognized his outstanding talent as a food critic, and from that point on discouraged his baking, ultimately driving him away. He also likes to tease Kawachi, to whom he was apparently very similar in his youth, occasionally to give him ideas on bread, but mostly just for the hell of it. He also can make Kawachi hallucinate at times. Due to a series of mishaps, he became the next heir to the Hashiguchi company, much to his displeasure.

character.name: Brad Kidd
character.description: A supporting character who was Kuroyanagi`s classmate in college and the president of a major detective agency in America. Kidd is used in many instances in the manga and anime as a sort of deus ex machina in reactions or flashbacks from a masseuse to an attorney or the head of a private investigation firm. For comedic effect, he always looks at the camera with the face from the same angle, no matter how much it needs to be turned

character.name: Kawachi Kyousuke
character.description: Coworker and sidekick to Azuma, from the Kansai area. Initially, Kawachi`s knowledge is superior to Azuma`s, but as the story develops he becomes the fall guy and comedic relief with jokes focused on his incessant cry of "What was that?!" (lit. "Nanyate?!") and numerous outrageous reactions/illusions in every chapter. He considers Azuma to be his rival, but the two develop a dynamic that is more like an older and younger brother, Kawachi being more experienced than Azuma in the world beyond bread initially, but gradually changed to one with Azuma knowing lots of knowledge while Kawachi can only act surprised.

character.name: Suwabara Kai
character.description: Kuroyanagi`s understudy, a serious bread artisan. A master of the katana who claims to have left the swordsman path of destruction to follow the path of life-giving bread. Despite that, he often becomes very warrior-like and fearsome during baking competitions, which occasionally makes other characters wonder if he is truly focused on the `life-giving` aspect of his bread.

character.name: Kuroyanagi Ryou
character.description: The 22-year-old head at the main Pantasia branch, and a Harvard graduate with a Food Science diploma (he had a girlfriend named Cathy there but they got separated when he had to travel back to Japan). His passion and talent is food tasting, at which he excels. His strait-laced no-nonsense attitude belies his very silly quirk of making strange pun-based reactions to the delicious bread he`s eating. He used to be the student of Ken, but Ken drove Ryou away with his behaviour. He is also one of the many people who make fun of Kawachi.

character.name: Kanmuri Shigeru
character.description: An extremely talented Pantasia baker, encountered first during the Pantasia Newcomers` Tournament and discovered to possess the solar hands as well. A Harvard graduate like Kuroyanagi, he looks up to him as a mentor, calling him `Senpai` (which means Senior). He is considered as a "Harvard Junior Genius", having graduated the prestigious school at a very young age of sixteen. Originally working for Tsukino`s evil sister Yukino Azusagawa, Kanmuri defected to the Pantasia`s Southern Tokyo store to work with Azuma after Yukino blew up his research laboratory as a result of him losing to Azuma. He remained to keep the store throughout the Monaco Cup, but rejoined the team for the Yakitate!! 25/Yakitate!! 9 challenge. Recently revealed to be one out of the last two possible heirs to the Hashiguchi Company (the biggest gangster organization in Japan). Although he firmly states that he`d never join the Yakuza, problem sets as the other heir, Masanobu Tsutsumi, Shigeru`s half-brother, shares the same sentiments. Tsutsumi is jealous at his half-brother for getting all the attention from their father, thus fueling his own determination to defeat the younger boy in a cooking/baking competition. This problem is promptly settled with a one-on-one battle in Yakitate!! 25/Yakitate!! 9 (refer to Episode 62).

character.name: Azusagawa Mizuno
character.description: Tsukino`s little sister. Since Tsukino is a "love child", Mizuno has the support of her father. They have a bit of a rivalry over Azuma, whether for his baking skills or his heart. She is quite competitive, and not very honourable.

character.name: Azusagawa Yukino
character.description: The eldest daughter of Pantasia. Yukino can be quite cruel. She had intended to buy up her grandfather`s stock but ended up being the president of St. Pierre in a twist.

character.name: Kinoshita Kageto
character.description: With a mushroom-like head, Kageto Kinoshita works at Pantasia Southern Tokyo branch. Though all the characters talk about making new kinds of bread, he is usually the one who ends up doing all of the work at the store, and also while everyone else is involved with bread making competitions. At first glance he doesn`t stack up to bread makers like Kawachi and Azuma, but Kageto seems to have the strange ability to work so fast it looks like there are several of him at once as well as actually making clones of himself. This is because he was raised up in a family that works in a circus. He can also copy another`s bread-making skills 95% as good as the original. Kinoshita also possesses the ability to sense if other people are talking about him elsewhere. He often writes to his mother, who apparently, lives elsewhere, telling her about whatever happens at Pantasia.

character.name: Meister Kirisaki
character.description: He is the manager of the Pantasia Main Branch and a bread judge. Half-French, he is the son of Yuichi Kirisaki. The peacock feather in his mask is actually still attached to the bird itself, which is skillfully hidden by Meister`s mastery of magic tricks. Additionally, when tasting bread, the feathers in Meister`s mask can change, depending on how good the bread is. He seems to have some fan girls, who follow him whenever they can. Meister had a very tough childhood, his mother was simply a young woman owning a bread store at the time when she met Yuuichi, apparently the two of them fell in love and had Meister; but when she got pregnant again with Sophie, he left to chase his dream to make a traditional style Japanese bread. After a while he came back with a few loaves of bread, just when Meister thought he came back for them Kirisaki greedily ate all the bread in front of his face, and Meister never forgave him.

character.name: Mokoyama Tsuyoshi
character.description: A contemporary of Ken Matsushiro and a master of sweet breads. He had trained with Ken to receive "solar gauntlets," but after his promotions in St. Pierre, he became lazy and started slacking off. He worked at the St. Pierre main branch in South Tokyo — a store opposite the one managed by Ken and Tsukino. After drawing against Azuma in a nationally televised bread battle, Mokoyama was forced to leave St. Pierre and befriended Mizuno Azusagawa. He joined the Pantasia Newcomer`s Battle wearing a Koala mask where he tied Azuma once again. Later, in the Yakitate!! 9/25 arc, this time wearing a "Panda" mask, he lost to Azuma. Further, Azuma`s bamboo flavoured bread had the effect of transforming him into a real panda. Mokoyama was portrayed as a very effeminate man who was always worried about his complexion and appearance and at St. Pierre he had a harem of male bakers cater to his needs. His speciality is knitting, and he seems to be in love with the manager of Pantasia`s southern Tokyo branch. He calls him "Ken-chan" and in a picture Manager had drawn up, Mokoyama was shown peacefully knitting cloth that said "Ken ♥ Moko."

character.name: Pierrot Bolneze
character.description: A world class clown working as a bread judge, aged 22. Can speak 135 languages, divide into over a hundred copies of himself, and do all sorts of amazing things due to being `world-class` clown. Heir to the throne of Monaco, though he doesn`t know it at first until the second Monaco Cup competition. Pierrot learns that he is heir to Monaco only through blood loss, he has an ultra-rare blood type called Bombay blood, which the king of Monaco also has. He became a world class clown so that his parents might find him, who he believed had abandoned him at the circus as an infant. In fact, he was given up to be brought up by ordinary foster parents away from the Royal palace, according to Monaco tradition. But these parents ran away with the money paid to them, leaving Pierrot behind. When they committed suicide, he was pronounced dead, but actually ended up in the Quedam circus. His real mother had died at his birth. The King of Monaco (discovering he shared the same rare blood type with Pierrot) sacrificed himself to donate blood, after one of Pierrot`s reactions (Kawachi`s Final Victory) turns into `murder` and he reveals his true background. He is later nicknamed `Miracle Prince` and both teams decided to make a bread that let him see his parents once again. Azuma`s Japan #61 allows him to change history, save his mother and father, and alter his entire life for the better, it seems. Pierrot is the predominant character of the Monaco Cup Arc, who gives the series a fresh aspect, away from just bread-making.

character.name: Dave Hachiguchi
character.description: An exceedingly fat bread judge. The character was a self reference by the author of Hashiguchi Takashi. He used to be a successful manga artist, but he became too successful and gorged himself on only fine foods. That resulted in his excess fat and now he only says, "Busy, busy." His only means of judging is by screaming, louder meaning that its better. Hachiguchi`s first name is also a pun: while "Deebu" is the Japanese pronunciation of the name "Dave," as it is written (デーブ) is translated as "Fat" or "Fatty."

character.name: Leonhart XIV
character.description: King of Monaco. Father of Pierrot Bolneze. Died while due to giving too much blood to Pierrot after Pierrot was stabbed and in danger of blood loss. Was brought back to life along with his wife after Pierrot brings his mother and Leonhart`s wife close to a hospital due to a "time travel" doughnut made by Azuma.

character.name: Kirisaki Yuuichi
character.description: Azuma`s main antagonist, the owner of St. Pierre, and ironically, the same `kind old man` who encouraged Azuma and started his baking career in the very first chapter/episode. He is in league with Yukino, who, in her struggle to dominate her sisters for control of Pantasia, betrays the store and allows Kirisaki to buy it out. The reason for Pantasia`s involvement in the Monaco Cup is so that Kanmuri can organise the ten billion yen required to protect the company, but in the end, the plot fails. Kirisaki allows the team a final chance in the Yakitate!! 25 (manga) /Yakitate!! 9 (anime) competition to win back Pantasia, but his ulterior motives for this are not yet clear. Yuuichi`s brilliant and estranged son Meister Silvan Kirisaki is the general manager of Pantasia, and his daughter Sophie Balzac Kirisaki assists Azuma`s team during the Monaco Cup. Specialized in Gopan (Bread with rice or rice-based material in it), his baking ability is said to be strongest, as his bread can send even insensitive people into a strong reaction state where they feel that they are in the universe, and even Shadow can only copy him 98% on the first try. Ironically, Gopan is part of his dream to create a bread that can represent Japan, something Azuma`s Japan is attempting to do. At the beginning, the nature of his evil is left ambiguous, since it is implied that he only acts evil in order to push Azuma to improve his skills, and was never revealed in the Anime; in the anime, when he eats Kazuma`s bread in the final round of Yakitate!! 9, he experiences a change of heart and explains to Pierrot why he has been so cruel to Kazuma, but when the effect of Kazuma`s bread wears off, his original attitude returns and he continues to challenge Azuma. In the manga, it was revealed that his evilness was part of a reaction of his first Gopan, known as "Devil`s Gopan", which is so addictive that, aside from violent withdrawal symptoms, can also can transform a kind person to an evil person and vice versa; eventually, he was actually processed by the devil, and transformed into a hybrid of bread and human. It would seems that, when in Azuma`s presence, he does have the chance of reverting back to his old self. After eating Azuma`s ultimate Japan, he was reverted back to his old self.

character.name: Sophie Balzac Kirisaki
character.description: Meister`s younger sister. She remained in France as a baker. She is the female version of Meister, with the same blond hair and blue eyes.

character.name: Liu LaoMian
character.description: A Chinese chef whose field of expertise is naturally Chinese cuisine and a close friend of Matsushiro Ken. He is the successor of an ancient Chinese assassination group called Ryuuke Shinken. This fact attributes to his cooking skill. Early on, he taught Azuma and Kawachi how to make yakisoba upon Matsushiro`s request.

character.name: Monica Adenauer
character.description: Monica, after winning the 59th Pastries Competition, is the best pastry chef in the world despite being a relatively amateur baker. Her dream is to open a large candy shop, as part her father`s dream. Initially appeared as part of the American Team. She and Suwabara fell in love with each other, and challenged Pantasia together in Yakitate! 25/Yakitate!! 9. Upon losing to Azuma, Suwabara attempted to commit a harakiri. In order to save him, Matsushiro claimed that Monica was pregnant, Suwabara being the father of the child. However, it was never really stated if they really did do it or not, since Suwabara said, "Is it possible to make a woman pregnant just by a hug like this?"

character.name: Spencer Henry Hokou
character.description: Italian-American newcomer who worked at the Nagoya branch of Pantasia. When he challenges Azuma at the New Comers Battle. He`s later seen at the Monaco Cup championships, challenging one of Azuma`s team members.

character.name: Azusagawa Sadanao
character.description: Pantasia`s Owner and the grandfather of the three Azusagawa sisters.

character.name: Edward Kaiser
character.description: The three brothers are the owners of the largest bakery chain in France. Aside from Solar Hands (which all top bakers in France must have), they also have extreme nimble fingers of goddess hands (which Azuma and Suwabara also possess). Gran Kaiser is also unique, in that his father also trained him such that his arms are abnormally large and strong, powerful enough to support the weight of him and his brothers. They are always hidden under a bird-like mask.

character.name: Bob Kaiser
character.description: The three brothers are the owners of the largest bakery chain in France. Aside from Solar Hands (which all top bakers in France must have), they also have extreme nimble fingers of goddess hands (which Azuma and Suwabara also possess). Gran Kaiser is also unique, in that his father also trained him such that his arms are abnormally large and strong, powerful enough to support the weight of him and his brothers. They are always hidden under a bird-like mask.

character.name: Gran Kaiser
character.description: The three brothers are the owners of the largest bakery chain in France. Aside from Solar Hands (which all top bakers in France must have), they also have extreme nimble fingers of goddess hands (which Azuma and Suwabara also possess). Gran Kaiser is also unique, in that his father also trained him such that his arms are abnormally large and strong, powerful enough to support the weight of him and his brothers. They are always hidden under a bird-like mask.

character.name: Umino Katsuo
character.description: One of Kawachi`s opponents in the Newcomer`s battle, he was able to design a very nice looking bread in the shape of his girlfriend. However, after he lost, he began to wander the mountains, and met a pig, who taught him all about pigs. After granting the pig`s final request—-eating it-—his face had a reaction, causing his face to resemble a pig.

character.name: Heidi
character.description: Heidi is Dave`s assistant. Since he can`t move on his own, she`s the one doing the work for him.

character.name: Pantasia Group
character.description: The Pantasia Group is a large conglomerate that is mainly composed of the Pantasia chain of bakeries, but apparently also consists of a hotel chain (managed by Tsukino`s father), and several other service-related businesses.

character.name: Pantasia Minami Tokyo Shiten
character.description: The Pantasia South Tokyo Branch is the smallest of the branches owned by Azusagawa Sadanao`s granddaughters, owned by Tsukino, and managed by Matsushiro Ken. It is located very close to the St. Pierre main store.

character.name: Gaia
character.description: A parody of the Black Tri-Stars character by the same name.

character.name: Mash
character.description: A parody of the Black Tri-Stars character by the same name.

character.name: Ortega
character.description: A parody of the Black Tri-Stars character by the same name.

character.name: Kimura Megumi
character.description: The only person who acknowledge Pierrot`s talent in Japan, but soon they had to part their ways.

character.name: Chimatsuri Go
character.description: Go is the white haired member of CMAP. He possesses the Flame Arm (Honou no Ute), which surpasses the Solar Hands.

character.name: Kaname Hiroshi
character.description: Hiroshi is the CMAP member with the glasses. He is mainly known to be the trio`s main brains, in a sort of way. He also seems not to be too bright, as he had acknowledged Kawachi as the "commander" of Azuma`s gang since he was standing out of the match.

character.name: Miki Norihei
character.description: A chef famous for his brand of seaweed, he entered Yakitate!! 9 with the intent of challenging Azuma after seeing him on TV during the Monaco Cup. Despite the techniques Azuma used during the competition, Norihei was able to defeat him, making him the only competitor who has done so. Despite his win, Norihei encouraged Azuma to strive to do better by giving him a recipe book on seaweed.

character.name: Shizuto Narumi
character.description: Shizuto is the long haired member of CMAP. He has a habit of saying "I kinda want you to die!" to his opponents, and his teammates.

character.name: Tsubozuka Takumi
character.description: Takumi is the most popular member of CMAP. He has red emo hair and somewhat sleepy looking eyes. Takumi is admired by lots of people, especially girls. He takes cooking as serious business. Because he has often played foreign roles, eventually, he has to speak both English and Japanese at the same time. He quit the group after Azuma defeated him. He resembles the character Akira Kamio from The Prince of Tennis. He also treats Azuma, Kanmuri and Kawachi very kindly after his match, having quit CMAP. He even gives them acupuncture to make up for the trouble.

character.name: Tsutsumi Masanobu
character.description: Masanobu is an Austrian court chef and Shigeru Kanmuri`s half-brother whose speciality is jam. He competed against Kanmuri during the Yakitate! 25/Yakitate!! 9 program to decide who should take over their father`s yakuza business. Despite his strong inferiority complex, he hates losing and is jealous of Kanmuri as he felt that Kanmuri`s life was easier.

character.name: White Shadow
character.description: A famous mime at least as good as Marcel Marceau, he is able to copy every actions of any human being perfectly; so perfect is that he unconsciously copy others, and thus forced to roll his eyes upward such that he do not see other people. Due to his perfect copy ability, Shadow can copy other baker`s technique and recipe 100%, but even with Yuuichi Kirisaki as his basis, he is only able to copy 98% the first time. Due to this, he is one of the strongest baker Azuma has face, as he basically became Kirisaki himself.

episode.title: 来たぞっ!! 太陽の手を持つ少年!
He`s Here!! The Boy with the Hands of the Sun!
Il est arrivé !! Le garçon aux mains solaires !
เด็กหนุ่มผู้มีหัตถ์ตะวัน มาแล้ว!
Kita zo!! Taiyou no Te o Motsu Shounen!
episode.summary: Kazuma Azuma lives in the country and is in a family of rice farmers. When his sister Inaho asks to have bread for bread for breakfast, grandfather Umataro refuses. It’s up to Kazuma to make a bread that will convince him! His journey for Ja-pan starts now! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Preview
マハラジャッ!! 富士山が降ってきた日!
Maharajah!! The Day Mt. Fuji Fell!
Maharajah !! Le jour où le mont Fuji est tombé !
วันที่ภูเขาไฟฟูจิหล่น!
Maharajah!! Fuji-san ga Futtekita Hi!
episode.summary: Kazuma takes the recruitment exam to get accepted into Pantasia, the best bakery in Japan, and he meets the ambitious yet snarky Kyoutaro Kawachi, who is willing to sabotage Kazuma’s dough to win. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 黒コゲ!! これが究極の黒輪さん!?
Charred!! This Is the Ultimate Claus Swann!?
Complètement cramé !! C’est lui, Kurowa-san ?
ไหม้ๆดำๆ เนี่ยนะเหรอคุโรวะซังด่านสุดท้าย
Kurokoge! Kore ga Kyuukyoku no Kurowa-san!?
episode.summary: Kazuma and Kawachi work together to make the ultimate croissant, Ja-pan #43. But can it stand up against the croissant made by the strongest of the rookies, Kai Suwabara? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヒヒーン!! 馬味いパンを作れ!
Neigh!! Make Good Grazing Bread!
Brrr !! Faites un pain chevalement bon !
ฮี้ๆๆ ทำขนมปังม้ากินกันเถอะ!
Hihiin!! Umai Pan o Tsukure!
episode.summary: It’s Kazuma and Kawachi’s first day of work at Pantasia’s South Tokyo, but before they can be recognized as true bread artisans, they must satisfy the manager’s request to make a bread that even a horse will eat. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美メェ~!! 決め手は究極のバター!
Not Baaaad!! Ultimate Butter Is the Clincher!
Quel délice !! L’essentiel est dans le beurre !
แบ่ะๆๆๆ เคล็ดลับอยู่ที่สุดยอดเนย!
Umee!! Kimete wa Kyuukyoku no Butter!
episode.summary: Kazuma and Kawachi both try and find a way to make a bread that the manager’s horse will eat. Kawachi decides to use oats, while Kazuma makes butter. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 本店だ!! 踊るマイスター!
It`s the Main Store!! The Dancing Meister!
La maison mère !! Meister mène la danse !
มาสเตอร์เต้นรำ จากสาขาใหญ่!
Honten Da!! Odoru Meister!
episode.summary: Manager Matsushiro challenges the manager of St. Pierre’s main store, Mokoyama, to a bread battle, which will be broadcast live. Can Kazuma win with his Ja-pan? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: びっくり服部!! 秘密のタレで変身じゃ!
Doc Shock!! Secret Sauce Transformation!
Hattori est surpris !! Une sauce qui rehausse le pain !
อาจารย์ฮัตโตริตกใจ ! แปลงร่างด้วยซ้อสสูตรลับ!
Bikkuri Hattori!! Himitsu no Tare de Henshin ja!
episode.summary: The bread battle has begun! Mokoyama unveils his ridiculously sweet Kouign Pudding Amman, which the judges give a perfect score! Does Kazuma’s Ja-pan stand a chance? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 河内改!! 太陽のガントレット!
Kawachi Prime!! The Gauntlets of the Sun!
Kyôsuke nouvelle version !! Les gants solaires !
คาวาจิคนใหม่ กับปลอกแขนตะวัน
Kawachi Kai!! Taiyou no Gauntlet!
episode.summary: South Tokyo receives their invitations for the Pantasia Rookie Competition, a tournament for all Pantasia newcomers to vie for baking supremacy. After feeling like he can’t match Kazuma, Tsukino helps Kawachi train to acquire the Gauntlets of the Sun. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Trailer
負けへん!! 大阪パンで勝負や!
I Won`t Lose!! I`ll Fight Ya with Osaka Bread!
Je ne vais pas perdre !! Le pain d’Osaka me fera gagner !
ไม่ยอมแพ้หรอก จะชนะด้วยขนมปังโอซาก้านี่ล่ะ!
Makehen!! Oosaka Pan de Shoubu ya!
episode.summary: Kawachi is continuing his training, but still hasn’t come up with an idea for what kind of bread he will submit for the contest preliminaries. Will he come up with something in time? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: それぞれの開幕!! パンタジア新人戦開始!
Their Respective Beginnings!! Pantasia`s Rookie Competition Opens!
Lever de rideaux !! Le concours des nouveaux !
เปิดตัวต่างๆกัน! ศึกหน้าใหม่ปังตาเซียเริ่มขึ้นแล้ว!
Sorezore no Kaimaku!! Pantasia Shinjinsen Kaishi!
episode.summary: Both Kazuma and Kawachi have made it past the preliminaries and now the Rookie Competition has officially begun! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: クズカスッ!! 和馬が選んだ最低バター!
Riffraff Scum!! Kazuma Chooses the Worst Butter!
Des restes !! Kazuma choisit le pire des beurres !
เจ้าพวกห่วยแตก กับ เนยยอดแย่ที่คาสึมะเลือก!
Kuzukasu!! Kazuma ga Eranda Saitei Butter!
episode.summary: For their first task, Kazuma and Kawachi must make a butter roll… but Kazuma chose the worst possible butter for the assignment! Can he possibly make anything good enough to pass? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 和馬失格!? 起死回生のウトラC!
Kazuma Failed!? Ultra C to the Rescue!
Kazuma a-t-il échoué !? La résurrection d’Ultra-C !
คาสึมะจะตกรอบ!? กับการฟื้นคืนชีพด้วยCพิเศษ!
Kazuma Shikkaku!? Kishikaisei no Ultra C!
episode.summary: Kazuma almost faces the end! Will his poor choice of butter disqualify him from the contest already? And, Tsukino comes face to face with her younger sister, Mizuno, who proposes a bet. If Mizuno wins, then Kazuma will have to transfer to her store! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヘイお待ち!! メロンパンでメロンメロン!
Order`s Up!! Going Bananas for Melon Bread!
C`est prêt !! Le melon pan qui rend gaga !
เฮ้ มาแล้วครับ ขนมปังเมล๊อน เมล่อน!
Hey Omachi!! Melon Pan de Melon Melon!
episode.summary: In this round, Kazuma is up against Mizuno, and he has to make melon bread. The problem? He has no idea how to make melon bread! Can he possibly beat Mizuno, who is not only incredibly skilled, but who also uses premier ingredients? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 美麺ーッ!! 焼きそばパンの落とし穴!
Noodlicious!! The Pitfalls of Yakisoba Bread!
Délicieux ! Le piège du Yakisoba-Pan !
เส้นอาหย่อยยย กับหลุมพรางขนมปังยากิโซบะ!
Bimen!! Yakisoba Pan no Otoshiana!
episode.summary: The theme of the next round is Yakisoba bread, and the twist is that challengers this round will cook the yakisoba. Kazuma, however, is a terrible cook, so Mr. Matsushiro recruits an old friend to teach Kazuma and Kawachi about the way of noodles. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強チーム!! 小野小町さんで勝つんじゃ!
Invincible Team!! Win with Ono no Komachi!
La meilleure des équipes ! On gagnera avec Ono no Komachi !
สุดยอดทีมแกร่ง ! จะชนะด้วย คุณโอโนโนะ โคมาจิ นี่ล่ะ!
Saikyou Team!! Onono Komachi-san de Katsu n ja!
episode.summary: Kawachi finds the yakisoba challenge quite easy, but Kazuma can’t get the hang of cooking. Will he be able to think of something in time before he has to face Spencer Henry Hoko, an amazing baker who is renowned for his yakisoba bread? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ミドリの奇跡!! 魔法使い和馬ッ!
A Green Miracle!! Kazuma the Magician!
Le miracle vert ! Kazuma le magicien !
ปาฎิหารย์สีเขียว ! จอมเวทย์คาสึมะ!
Midori no Kiseki!! Mahou Tsukai Kazuma!
episode.summary: Kazuma is up against Koala, and the theme is to make an “animal” bread. Can Kazuma stand up against the powerful, mysterious Koala? Or will Koala secure victory for Mizuno? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 大決戦!! コアラの竜vs和馬のカメ!
The Big Showdown!! Koala`s Dragon vs. Kazuma`s Turtle!
Combat décisif ! Le dragon de Koala contre la tortue de Kazuma !
ศึกครั้งใหญ่ มังกรของโคอาล่าปะทะเต่าของคาสึมะ!
Daikessen!! Koala no Ryuu vs Kazuma no Kame!
episode.summary: Koala’s bread is a dragon and Kazuma’s bread… is in the shape of a turtle? Which will be victorious? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 祈りをこめて!! 墓前の誓い!
With Our Prayers Behind It!! A Graveside Vow!
Avec toutes nos prières ! Le serment devant la tombe
ตั้งจิตอธิษฐาน สาบานต่อหน้าหลุมศพ!
Inori o Komete!! Bozen no Chikai!
episode.summary: Tsukino goes to visit her mother’s grave, while Kawachi goes up against Katsuo in the contest. After seeing what Tsukino has lost, the South Tokyo crew makes a vow to win for her! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悪夢の準決勝!! 雪乃の卑劣な罠!
Nightmarish Semifinals!! Yukino`s Dastardly Trap!
Demi-finale cauchemardesque ! Le piège infâme de Yukino !
ฝันร้ายรอบชิงชนะเลิศ และแผนสกปรกของยูกิโนะ
Akuma no Junkesshou!! Yukino no Hiretsu na Wana!
episode.summary: It’s time for the semifinals! Kawachi is up against scientific genius Shigeru Kanmuri. Kawachi is feeling confident, but something seems to be wrong with his dough… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 不屈の闘志!! 逆境をバネに立ち上がれ!
Indomitable Fighting Spirit!! Let Adversity Bring You to Your Feet!
Un esprit inébranlable ! Fais face à l`adversité !
ความตั้งใจมุ่งมั่น ลุกยืนหยัดได้บนอุปสรรค!
Fukutsu no Toushi!! Gyakkyou o Bane ni Tachi Agare!
episode.summary: Kawachi’s dough won’t ferment despite his best efforts and he collapses after become exhausted. What could have been the cause? Does South Tokyo stand a chance against such foul play? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 試作史上最強のパン!! ジャパン44号じゃッ!
It`s the Mightiest Bread in the History of Prototypes!! Ja-pan No. 44!
Le meilleur de tous les Ja-pans ! Le Ja-pan n°44 !
ขนมปังที่แข็งแกร่งที่สุดในประวัติศาสตร์ เจปังหมายเลข 44!
Shisaku Shijou Saikyou no Pan!! Japan 44 Gou ja!
episode.summary: After Kawachi’s horrible defeat, Kazuma vows to avenge him. So Kazuma uses a slab of petalite to make Ja-pan #44, a bread so delicious that the person who eats it will be whisked away to Heaven! Has Kazuma finally gotten serious? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: モチモチ対決!! 東和馬VS冠茂!
Springy Showdown!! Kazuma Azuma vs. Shigeru Kanmuri!
Une finale élastique ! Kazuma Azuma contre Shigeru Kanmuri !
การเจอกันของความนุ่มเด้ง อาสึมะคาสึมะ ปะทะ คังมุริชิเงรุ
Mochi Mochi Taiketsu!! Azuma Kazuma VS Kanmuri Shigeru!
episode.summary: Kawachi meets a young nun who teaches him how to make incredible bread and stand up to geniuses! Meanwhile, Kazuma is about to face off against Kanmuri to see who can make the springier bread! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 空飛ぶマイスター!! 勝つのはどっち!?
The Flying Meister!! Who Will Win!?
Meister s`envole ! Qui a gagné ?
มาสเตอร์เหินฟ้า ฝ่ายไหนจะชนะ
Sora Tobu Meister!! Katsu no wa Docchi!?
episode.summary: Kazuma is up against Kanmuri! It’s time to see who will win! Their battle is overseen by the illustrious Meister Kirisaki, who gives Kanmuri a perfect score. Can Kazuma hope to win against a scientific genius who graduated from Harvard at a young age? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決勝戦直前!! 和馬に迫る黒い影
The Final Match Is Near!! A Dark Shadow Closes In on Kazuma!
Avant la finale ! Une ombre plane sur Kazuma
ก่อนการแข่งรอบชิงชนะเลิศกับ เงาดำมืดที่คุกคามอาสึมะ
Kesshousen Chokuzen!! Kazuma ni Semaru Kuroi Kage
episode.summary: Before he faces Suwabara, the strongest of the rookies, Mr. Matsushiro tells Kawachi to go train at St. Andrew’s church. Meanwhile, Yukino breaks Kazuma’s petalite stone! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: なんやてッ!! 河内, 漢の猛特訓!
What the-!? Kawachi`s Intensive Manliness Training!
Quoi ? L`entraînement intensif de Kawachi !
อะไรนะ! คาวาจิฝึกพิเศษแบบลูกผู้ชาย!
Nanyate!! Kawachi, Otoko no Moutokkun!
episode.summary: The villainous Yukino, true to her word, destroys Kanmuri’s lab after he loses to Kazuma. Meanwhile, the match between Suwabara and Kawachi is about to begin! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新人戦最終試合!! 歌って踊るフランスパン!
The Rookie Competition`s Final Match!! Singing and Dancing French Bread!
Dernier match ! Les pains qui chantent et dansent !
ปิดฉากการแข่งศึกหน้าใหม่!! ขนมปังฝรั่งเศสร้องเพลงเต้นรำ!
Shinjinsen Saishuu Jiai!! Utatte Odoru France Pan!
episode.summary: Kawachi makes “Singing” French bread, while Suwabara rises to the challenge with his “Dancing” French bread. Will this match end with… a draw? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: レッツみんなでパン作り!! ジャぱん2号じゃっ!
Let`s All Make Bread Together!! It`s Ja-pan No. 2!
Faisons tous du pain ! Le ja-pan 2 !
ทุกคนมาทำขนมปังกันเถอะ! เจปังหมายเลข2จ้า
Let`s Minna de Pan Tsukuri!! Japan 2 Gou ja!
episode.summary: After the awards ceremony for the contest, the South Tokyo crew return to their store, and Kazuma teaches a kid the joy of cooking bread. Follow along and learn how to make your very own Ja-pan in this episode! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 百億の男!? パンタジア存亡の危機!
The Ten-Billion Yen Man!? Pantasia`s Fate Hangs in the Balance!
L`homme qui valait 10 milliards ! Pantasia est en crise !
บุรุษพันล้าน!? ปังตาเซียวิกฤติแล้ว!
Hyakuoku no Otoko!? Pantasia Sonbou no Kiki!
episode.summary: Though Kawachi has departed for the main store, life has returned to normal for the South Tokyo branch. Or has it? The villainous Yukino is still plotting to take down the South Tokyo store, so Kanmuri proposes a risky plan to save the bakery! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 迫撃!! ブラックじゃぱん誕生!
A Close Attack!! The Birth of Black Ja-pan!
Attaque ! La naissance du black ja-pan !
ประชิดจู่โจม! กำเนิดแบล็คเจปัง!
Hakugeki!! Black Japan Tanjou!
episode.summary: Yukino hires three specialists from the St. Pierre branch in Kyushu who are able to copy any kind of bread. Can Kazuma’s Black Ja-pan counter their threat and expose Yukino for the villain she is? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いざフランス!! 目指せモナコカップ!
Now, to France!! Aiming for the Monaco Cup!
En route pour la France ! Visons la Coupe de Monaco !
มุ่งสู่ฝรั่งเศส! เป้าหมายคือโมนาโคคัพ!
Iza France!! Mezase Monaco Cup!
episode.summary: Kazuma, Kawachi, and Suwabara depart for France to train under Meister Kirisaki’s younger sister, Sophie. But when they learn that her bakery is being threatened, they decide to help her fight! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 一触即発!! 禁断のロダン作戦!
An Explosive Situation!! The Forbidden Rodin Tactic!
Situation explosive ! La plan Rodin interdit !
สถานการณ์ตึงเครียด!! แผนโรแดงต้องห้าม!
Isshokusokuhatsu!! Kindan no Rodan Sakusen!
episode.summary: For the Monaco Cup qualifying match, Kawachi proposes that they make a bread modeled after Rodin’s famous sculpture, “The Thinker.” The catch? He has to stay inside the bread sculpture during the competition! Can he possibly make it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: これぞ世界レベル!! 嵐を呼ぶルーレット!
This Is Truly World-Class Level!! The Roulette That Brings Chaos!
Voilà le niveau mondial ! La roulette infernale !
นี่แหละระดับโลก รูเล็ทที่เรียกพาย
Korezo Sekai Level!! Arashi o Yobu Roulette!
episode.summary: The Monaco Cup has officially begun, and Team Japan’s fate rests on their luck with the roulette. Will they get the ingredients they need? Can they possibly make a bread just with eggs? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 3時のおやつ!! ジャぱん21号じゃッ!
Three O`Clock Is Snack Time!! This Is Ja-pan #21!
Le goûter de 15h ! Le ja-pan 21 !
ของว่างตอนตีสาม! เจปังหมายเลข21!
3 Ji no Oyatsu!! Japan 21 Gou ja!
episode.summary: Things don’t look good for Team Japan. France is a tough contender, and the judge is more interested in explaining his origins than judging the bread! Can Kazuma’s Ja-pan #21 pull through? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ルパン3号! パン・デ・エピス戒(改)!
Lu-pan #3!! Pain d`Epices Kai (Prime)!
Le lu-pain 3 ! La pain d`épice à la Kai
ลูแปงหมายเลข3 แปงเดอเอปิสไค
Lupan 3 Gou!! Pan De Ebisu Kai!
episode.summary: After using a roulette table to determine ingredients, what could possibly come next? How about a slot machine? Suwabara steps up and wins a lot of coins at the slots, but things sound too good to be true… and what’s this about Lu-pan? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 世界が注目!! モナコカップ本選スタート!
The World`s Watching!! The Monaco Cup Main Event Starts Now!
Le monde nous regarde ! Début de la coupe de Monaco !
ทั่วโลกจับตามอง!! โมนาโกคัพรอบจริงสตาร์ท!
Sekai ga Chuumoku!! Monaco Cup Honsen Start!
episode.summary: Spencer Henry Hoko, from the Newcomer Contest, is back and has joined Team America! But why is he working for St. Pierre? Back at the South Tokyo branch, Kanmuri and the others desperately try to keep the store afloat with a demonstration sale! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スピード勝負!! アレでチンしてッ!
Speed Test!! Microwave It!
Épreuve de vitesse ! Passe-le au four à micro-ondes !
แข่งความเร็ว!! ขนมปังไมโครเวฟ!
Speed Shoubu!! Are de Chin Shite!
episode.summary: For the quarterfinals, contestants have to make a bread in less than 60 minutes. Can it be done? Kazuma has the idea to use a microwave, but when Pierrot reveals he absolutely hates them, things don’t look good for Team Japan! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サバイバル!! 無人島のパン職人!
Survival!! Bakers on a Deserted Island!
Jeu de survie ! Des boulangers sur une île déserte !
เซอร์ไววัล! ช่างทำขนมปังบนเกาะร้าง
Survival!! Mujintou no Pan Shokunin!
episode.summary: The contestants are brought to a tropical paradise and have to make a sweet bread with ingredients found on the island. Things take a turn for the worse though when Kazuma gets caught in a whirlpool! Forget about winning… can they survive? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: いざ泳げ!! 南の島のタイ焼きくん!
Now Swim!! Taiyaki of the Southern Island!
Nage ! Le taiyaki de l`île tropicale !
ว่ายน้ำเข้า!! ไทยากิคุงแห่งเกาะตอนใต้!
Iza Oyoge!! Minami no Shima no Tai-Yaki-kun!
episode.summary: Team France does the unthinkable and sets fire to the island in the hopes of stripping away Team Japan’s chances of winning. Yuichiki Kirisaki and Chairman Lemay aren’t just out to beat Team Japan… they want them dead! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 地獄へのダイブ!! 新たなる謀略!
The Skydive to Hell! A New Kind of Diabolical Plan!
Le saut de l`enfer ! Un nouveau complot !
ดำดิ่งสู่นรก!! แผนร้ายครั้งใหม่!
Jigoku e no Dive!! Aratanaru Houryaku!
episode.summary: After surviving the incident on the island, Team Japan lives to fight another day. Because the last round’s results were annulled, a rematch will be held in Mexico. But something seems off about those professional skydivers hired for the match… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ピエロ大誤算!! 最後の晩餐, お味はいかが?
Pierrot Makes a Huge Mistake! How Does the Last Supper Taste?
Grosse erreur de Pierrot ! Comment est le dernier dîner ?
เปียโร่คำนวณพลาดมหันต์!! อาหารค่ำมื้อสุดท้าย รสชาติเป็นไงบ้าง?
Piero Dai Gosan!! Saigo no Bansan, Oaji wa Ikaga?
episode.summary: After rescuing Kazuma and the others, Pierrot leads everyone to an underground lake. He promises everyone that he’ll swim outside and find help, but there’s one problem... he can’t swim! Can Pierrot get out of it, or did he bite off more than he could chew? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王様の質問!! 美味しそうなパンを最初に食べさせるのは?
The King`s Question!! Who Would You First Serve Delicious Bread To?
La question du prince ! Qui mange le pain en premier ?
คำถามของพระราชา!! ขนมปังที่น่าอร่อยจะให้ใครกินคนแรก?
Ou-sama no Shitsumon!! Oishisou na Pan o Saisho ni Tabesaseru no wa?
episode.summary: After being rescued from the cave, Kazuma and the others meet the King of Monaco, who apologizes for all of the threats they’ve faced and offers them any ingredient they wish. In exchange though, they must answer his question! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇々怪々!! カイザーの正体!
The Weirdoes!! Unmasking Kayser!
Étrange ! La vrai nature des Kayser !
พิสดารพันลึก!! ร่างจริงของไกเซอร์!
Kiki Kaikai!! Kaizer no Shoutai!
episode.summary: It’s time for Team Japan to face against Team France—Kayser! The Kayser brothers reveal their true form, and Gran Kayser has more special abilities than anyone could have imagined! And what’s worse, Kazuma might be disqualified for being late! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 栄養たっぷり!! スポーツパン対決!
Full of Nutrients!! Sports Bread Showdown!
Nourrissant ! L`épreuve des pains sportifs !
สารอาหารเต็มเปี่ยม!! ศึกขนมปังสปอร์ต!
Eiyou Tappuri !! Sports Pan Taiketsu!
episode.summary: Kazuma arrives in the nick of time and faces off against Gran Kayser. Suwabara’s red bread couldn’t beat Kayser’s blue bread. Will Kazuma’s black bread tip the scales? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 音速の脅威!! ごぱん97号!
The Speed of Sound Menace!! Go-pan #97!
Menace supersonique ! Le go-pan 97 !
คุกคามด้วยความเร็วเสียง!! โกปังหมายเลข97!
Onsoku no Kyuui!! Gopan 97 Gou!
episode.summary: After conquering Team France, Team Japan is feeling confident, but another threat looms overhead: Team America. They’ve faced Spencer Henry Hoko before, but just who are Shadow and Monica? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 裸[ラ]・裸[ラ]・裸[ラ]!! 華麗なるパン勝負!
La La La! (Bare, Bare, Bare!): The Great Bread Battle!
Nue, Nu, Nus ! Le match des pains artistiques !
โป๊ๆๆ! ศึกขนมปังสวยงาม!
Ra * Ra * Ra!! Karei Naru Pan Shoubu!
episode.summary: Suwabara faces off against Monica Adenauer of Team America, who is revealed to be a world-champion patissier! Can he possibly beat her in making an artistic bread? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ピエロ護送!? 愛がぎっしり詰まったパン!
The Clown Jailed!? Bread Full of Love!
Pierrot arrêté ? Un pain fait avec amour
คุมขังเปียโร่!? ขนมปังที่เปี่ยมด้วยความรัก!
Piero Gosou!? Ai Gagishiri Tsumata Pan!
episode.summary: It’s time for the judging! It’s Suwabara’s golden P’ain D’or against Monico’s beautiful five-layered flower bread. Before giving the results though, Pierrot turns himself into the police! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ヴィクトリー!! パン業界に革命を!
Victory!! A Revolution in the Bread Industry!
Victoire ! Révolutionne le monde du pain !
วิคตอรี่! ปฏิวัติวงการขนมปัง
Victory! Pan Gyoukai ni Kakumei o!
episode.summary: It’s time for Kawachi to face off against Spencer Henry Hoko! After learning more about how hard his father worked, Kawachi is more determined than ever to obtain victory! Can he achieve his father’s dreams? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 名探偵ピエロ!! 命をかけたリアクション!
The Great Detective Pierrot!! Risking His Life for a Reaction!
Détective Pierrot ! Une réaction mortelle !
นักสืบชื่อดังเปียโร่!! รีแอคชั่นที่เดิมพันด้วยชีวิต!
Meitantei Piero!! Inochi o Kaketa Reaction!
episode.summary: Pierrot’s been stabbed! And Detective Conan showed up? What’s going on here? Has Kawachi been accused of murder? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: VIP席で再会!! ヘブン・アゲイン!
Reunited in the VIP Section!! Heaven Again!
Retrouvailles VIP ! Heaven Again !
พบกัน ณ ที่นั่ง VIP!! เฮเว่น.อเกน!
VIP Seki de Saikai!! Heaven Again!
episode.summary: Pierrot is at death’s door and everyone is scrambling to save him! However, he has a rare blood type and no one knows any donors… but what’s this? The King has the same blood type? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宇宙を魅せる!! ゴぱんを継ぐ男!
Blasting Off into Space!! The Man Who Succeeds Go-pan!
En route vers les étoiles ! L`héritier du go-pan !
มองเห็นอวกาศ!! ชายผู้สืบทอดโกปัง!
Uchuu o Miseru!! Gopan o Tsugu Otoko!
episode.summary: After tragically losing his father, Pierrot still carries on with the contest. But Shadow from Team America promises to reunite Pierrot with his mother with his Go-pan! Can Go-Pan send Pierrot to the Milky Way to meet his mother who died and became a star? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 集められた究極の食材!! 史上最大の決勝戦!
The Ultimate Ingredients!! The Greatest Final Battle!
Les ingrédients ultimes ! La plus grande des finales !
พาเหรดวัตถุดิบสุดยอด!! ศึกตัดสินครั้งใหญ่ในประวัติศาสตร์!
Atsumerareta Kyuukyoku no Shokuzai!! Shijousaidai no Kesshousen!
episode.summary: It’s time for the final match. Kazuma of Team Japan vs. Shadow of Team America. Ja-pan vs. Go-pan. Who will win? And just how does Kazuma plan to reunite Pierrot with his parents with his bread? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 時を越えるピエロ!! ジャぱん世界の頂点へ!?
Pierrot Transcends Time!! Ja-pan Becomes the Best in the World!?
Pierrot traverse le temps ! Le Ja-pan au sommet du monde !
เปียโร่ข้ามกาลเวลา!! สู่จุดสุดยอดของโลกเจปัง!?
Toki o Koeru Piero!! Japan Sekai no Chouten e!?
episode.summary: Kazuma’s Ja-pan #61 has sent Pierrot back 23 years in time! Can Pierrot save his parents and alter the course of history? Or will he be doomed to a tragic life? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 当地パン対決!! なんてったってアイドル!
Local Bread Battle!! This Is Being an Idol!
Duel de pains régionaux ! Ce n`est qu`une star !
ดวลขนมปังท้องถิ่น!! ไอด้อลอะไรกันนี่!
Touchi Pan Taiketsu!! Nantettatte Idol!
episode.summary: The first opponent that Kazuma and the others face is the enigmatic Takumi Tsubozuka, a member of CMAP, a team of celebrity chefs. Can Kazuma, Kawachi, and Kanmuri come up with a bread that will defeat Tsubozuka and make use of Oma’s local ingredients? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 霧崎からの挑戦状! 新番組『焼きたて!!9』スタート
Challenged by Kirisaki!! A New Program, `Yakitate!! Nine,` Starts!
Le défi de Kirisaki ! Nouvelle émission : Yakitate 9 !
สารท้าดวลจากคิริซากิ! รายการใหม่แชมป์ขนมปัง 9 จังหวัด สตาร์ท
Kirisaki kara no Chousenjou! Shin Bangumi "Yakitate!! 9" Start
episode.summary: Mr. Kirisaki has bought out Pantasia and merged it with St. Pierre! He then throws down to the gauntlet to Kazuma and the others by issuing them this challenge: If they want to save Pantasia, they must compete in his Yakitate 9 contest! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目覚めよ!! スーパー黒柳!
Awaken!! Super Kuroyanagi!
Transformation ! Super Kuroyanagi !
ตื่นขึ้นมาแล้ว!! ซูเปอร์คุโรยานางิ!
Mezameyo!! Super Kuroyanagi!
episode.summary: The bake-off has begun! Will Tsubozuka win with his charred tuna, or will Kazuma come from behind with his chawanmushi bread made with sea urchin? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: あやうし黒柳!! 失われたリアクション!
Kuroyanagi in Trouble!! The Lost Reactions!
Kuroyanagi en difficulté ! Réactions perdues !
คุโรยานางิอันตราย!! รีแอคชั่นที่สูญเสียไป!
Ayaushi Kuroyanagi!! Ushinawareta Reaction!
episode.summary: After an accident, Kuroyanagi lost all sense of taste. Will he have to retire from being a judge forever? Meanwhile, Kazuma has to think of a way to defeat his old friend, Liu, in a match to make Chinese-style steamed buns! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ウー, マンゴー!! CMAPの大逆襲!
Ooh, Mango!! CMAP`s Counterattack!
Oh, mango ! Les CMAP contre-attaquent!
อื้อ แมงโก้!! การตอบโต้ของCMAP
Uu, Mango!! CMAP no Dai Gyakushuu!
episode.summary: Tsubozuka has become a friend of Kazuma and the others. But the other members of CMAP aren’t so forgiving. Now they’re dueling against Kazuma in Saito. How in the world can Kazuma beat three excellent bakers, and use a little clay haniwa statute to do it? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 愛[ラブ]は西都も救う!! 太陽の手VS炎の腕!
Love Will Save Even Saito! Hands of the Sun vs. Arms of Flame!
L`amour fleurit à Saito ! Mains solaires contre bras ardents !
ความรักช่วยกอบกู้ไซโตะ!! หัตถ์ตะวัน V.S แขนอัคคี
Ai [Love] wa Saito mo Sukuu!! Taiyou no Te VS Honoo no Ude!
episode.summary: CMAP not only has incredible knowledge and unbeatable talent, but one of their members even has the Arms of Flame, which burn even hotter than Kazuma’s Hands of the Sun! Will Kazuma’s love of good food and good friends be enough? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ニンニンニン!! オレの忍道だってばよ!
Nin Nin Nin! My Way of the Ninja! Believe It!
Nin ! Nin ! Nin ! C`est mon Nindou !
นินๆๆ นี่แหละวิถีนินจาของฉัน
Nin Nin Nin!! Ore no Nindou Dattebayo!
episode.summary: A familiar pair returns, but something is different about them! Kazuma, Kawachi, and Kanmuri must do battle with a duo of ninjas using the local specialty of Omagari. Can Kazuma win even though both he and his opponent are using the same ingredients? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 曲がったことが大キライ!! 戒とモニカの二人三脚
I Hate Things That Are Twisted!! Kai and Monica`s Teamwork!
Je n`aime pas les courbes ! Le tandem Kai et Monika !
เกลียดอะไรงอๆ ที่สุด!! ไคกับโมนิก้าวิ่ง 3 ขา
Magatta Koto ga Daikirai!! Kai to Monica no Ninin Sankyaku
episode.summary: The ninjas are revealed to be Kai and Monica, and Kai makes a shocking declaration. If he can’t defeat Kazuma, he’ll commit suicide! Will his determination let him finally beat Kazuma? And will he really go through with it if he loses? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 冠の秘密!! 仁義なきジャム対決!
Kanmuri`s Secret!! A Jam Battle Without Honor!
Le secret de Kanmuri ! Un match qui part en confiture !
ความลับของคังมุริ!! ศึกแยมที่ไร้คุณธรรม
Kanmuri no Himitsu!! Jingi naki Jam Taiketsu!
episode.summary: Kanmuri’s past is brought to light and he may have to retire from his life as a baker! Will he be forced to leave his friends at Pantasia and become… a gangster!? And what’s worse, after getting sick, Kazuma has to sit this match out! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 兄弟対決!! 父が選んだ一流の男!
Brotherly Battle! The Top-Ranked Man Chosen by Father Is...!
Rivalité fraternelle ! La père choisit le meilleur !
ศึกของพี่น้อง!! ลูกผู้ชายตัวจริงที่พ่อเลือก!
Kyoudai Taiketsu!! Chichi ga Eranda Ichiryuu no Otoko!
episode.summary: It’s a showdown between estranged brothers. Neither wants to succeed, because both love cooking. Will their thoughts reach their father? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 海苔パン対決!! 超有名人が出るんですよ!
Nori Bread Battle!! A Super Famous Celebrity Appears!
Duel de pains au nori ! Contre une célébrité !
ศึกขนมปังสาหร่าย!! คนดังโผล่มาแล้ว
Nori Pan Taiketsu!! Chou Yumeijin ga Derun Desu yo!
episode.summary: Kazuma is up against his most powerful foe yet, the famous TV celebrity and comedian Norihei Miki! Can Kazuma possibly compete against such a legend, especially when the theme involves using seaweed, Norihei’s specialty? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝統の味!! 日本を想うココロはひとつ!
A Classic Taste! One Heart That Loves Japan!
Goût traditionnel ! Le Japon est dans nos cœurs !
รสชาติต้นตำรับ!! จิตใจที่คำนึงถึงญี่ปุ่นมีหนึ่งเดียว
Dentou no Aji!! Nippon o Omou Kokoro wa Hitotsu!
episode.summary: It’s time for Kuroyanagi to decide who will win the sixth round: Kazuma or Norihei. Kuroyanagi delivers his most expressive reactions yet in a battle that leaves Kazuma and the others stunned! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 恐怖のリベンジ!! パンダ男, 現る!
Terrifying Revenge!! Panda Man Appears!
Ultime revanche ! Le retour de l`homme-panda !
การแก้แค้นอันน่ากลัว มนุษย์แพนด้ามาแล้ว
Kyoufu no Revenge!! Panda Otoko, Arawaru!
episode.summary: Mokoyama has returned a changed man. Though he doesn’t wish to assist Yukino or Mr. Kirisaki in any way, he desperately wants to prove his worth by displaying his new form, Panda Man, and his new weapon, Super Baking Powder! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 奇跡の蒸しパン!! パンダがパンダになった日!
The Miraculous Steamed Bread!! The Day Panda Turned Into a Panda!
Un pain vapeur prodigieux ! Panda devient un vrai panda !
ขนมปังนึ่งปาฏิหารย์!! วันที่แพนด้ากลายเป็นแพนด้า
Kiseki no Mushi Pan!! Panda ga Panda ni Natta Hi!
episode.summary: The hot springs battle is boiling over and things start getting really bombastic when Panda’s bread explodes… three times! How can this possibly be? Has Mokoyama made the bread he’s always dreamed of making? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 太陽VS吹雪!! 究極のタルト対決!
Sun versus Blizzard!! The Ultimate Tart Match!
Le soleil contre la glace ! L`ultime duel de tartes !
ตะวันปะทะพายุหิมะ
Taiyou VS Fubuki!! Kyuukyoku no Tart Taiketsu!
episode.summary: Tsukino’s sister steps in to challenge Kazuma and the others in the semi-finals, in a match she is well-suited for: making tarts. After insulting a local fruit vendor, Kazuma decides to fight against her using the vendor’s specialty, preserved loquats! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: これが私の進む道!? ロード・オブ・ザ・ビワ!
Is This My Path to Take!? The Lord of the Loquat!
C`est ma destinée ! Le Seigneur des Nèfles !
นี่คือหนทางที่เราเลือกเดิน!? Lord of the บิวะ
Kore ga Watashi no Susumu Michi!? Lord of the Biwa!
episode.summary: Kazuma has been thrust into a fantasy world, and most take the “loquat” to the fires of a volcano and destroy it before the evil Snowza can use it to take over the world! This sounds an awful lot like a certain story about a ring… Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 本当に美味いパンを食べさせるのは!? ジャぱんよ, 永遠に!
Who Would You Serve Really Good Bread To!? Long Live Ja-pan!
A qui faire manger du bon pain ? Ja-pan, sois éternel !
คนที่จะให้ทานขนมปังอร่อยจริงๆ!? เจปัง Forever
Hontou ni Umai Pan o Tabesaseru no wa!? Japan yo, Eien ni!
episode.summary: The final showdown. Kazuma faces off against Yuichi Kirisaki’s son in a legendary battle in Kazuma’s own hometown. However, Kazuma won’t just have to win over Kuroyanagi - Yuichi Kirisaki and Pierrot also step up to the plate as judges! Source: crunchyroll
